resource_data:
<expression xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0 http://fire.eun.org/lode/imslorsltitm_v1p0.xsd" xmlns="http://www.imsglobal.org/xsd/imslorsltitm_v1p0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance">
  <identifier>
    <catalog>hdl</catalog>
    <entry>10494/105548</entry>
  </identifier>
  <identifier>
    <catalog>expression-cmr-id</catalog>
    <entry>105548</entry>
  </identifier>
  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206408</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">A More Perfect Union: Japanese Americans and the U.S. Constitution</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Ein Vollkommenerer Anschluß: Japanische 
Amerikaner und die VEREINIGTE STAATEN Beschaffenheit</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Une Union Plus parfaite : Américains 
japonais et la constitution des ETATS-UNIS</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Uma União Mais perfeita: Americanos 
japoneses e o constitution de ESTADOS UNIDOS</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Un'Unione Più perfetta: Americani 
giapponesi e la costituzione degli STATI UNITI</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Μια τελειότερη ένωση: Ιαπωνικοί Αμερικανοί και 
το ΑΜΕΡΙΚΑΝΙΚΟ σύνταγμα</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Una Unión Más perfecta: Americanos 
japoneses y la constitución de ESTADOS UNIDOS</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">tells the story that began during World War II, when nearly 120,000 Japanese Americans were forced from their homes into detention camps established by the U.S. government. Many spent three years living under armed guard, behind barbed wire.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Social Sciences</string>
          </keyword>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">erklärt die Geschichte, die während des Zweiten 
Weltkrieges anfing, als fast 120.000 japanische Amerikaner von ihren 
Häusern in die Internierungslager vorverlegt waren, die durch die 
VEREINIGTE STAATEN Regierung hergestellt wurden. Viele 
verbrachten drei Jahre, die unter bewaffnetem Schutz, hinter 
Stacheldraht leben.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">dit l'histoire qui a commencé pendant la 
deuxième guerre mondiale, quand presque 120.000 Américains japonais 
étaient obligatoires de leurs maisons dans des camps de détention 
établis par le gouvernement des ETATS-UNIS. Beaucoup ont passé
trois ans vivant sous la garde armée, derrière le barbelé.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">diz a história que começou durante a segunda 
guerra mundial, quando quase 120.000 americanos japoneses eram 
forçados de suas HOME nos acampamentos de detention estabelecidos 
pelo governo de ESTADOS UNIDOS. Muitos gastaram três anos que 
vivem sob protetor armado, atrás do arame farpado.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">dice alla storia che ha cominciato durante la 
seconda guerra mondiale, quando quasi 120.000 Americani giapponesi 
erano forzati dalle loro sedi negli accampamenti di detenzione 
stabiliti dal governo degli STATI UNITI. Molti hanno 
speso tre anni che vivono sotto la protezione munita, 
dietro filo spinato.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">λέει την ιστορία που άρχισε κατά τη διάρκεια του 
παγκόσμιου πολέμου ΙΙ, όταν αναγκάστηκαν σχεδόν 120.000 
ιαπωνικοί Αμερικανοί από τα σπίτια τους στα στρατόπεδα 
συγκεντρώσεως που καθιερώθηκαν από την ΑΜΕΡΙΚΑΝΙΚΗ κυβέρνηση. 
Πολλοί πέρασαν τρία έτη ζωντανός κάτω από την οπλισμένη 
φρουρά, πίσω από το οδοντωτό καλώδιο.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">cuenta la historia que comenzó durante la Segunda
Guerra Mundial, cuando casi 120.000 americanos japoneses eran forzados
de sus hogares en los campos de detención establecidos por el 
gobierno de ESTADOS UNIDOS. Muchos pasaron tres años que 
vivían bajo protector armado, detrás del alambre de púas.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Sozialwissenschaften</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Les Sciences Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Ciências Sociais</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Scienze Sociali</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Κοινωνικές επιστήμες</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Ciencias Sociales</string>
          </keyword>
        </general>
        <metaMetadata>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oercommons.org</catalog>
            <entry>1770206408</entry>
          </identifier>
          <language>en</language>
        </metaMetadata>
        <educational>
          <language>en</language>
        </educational>
        <rights>
          <copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
            <source>copyrightAndOtherRestrictionsValues</source>
            <value>yes</value>
          </copyrightAndOtherRestrictions>
          <description>
            <string language="en">Custom License</string>
          </description>
        </rights>
      </lom>
    </metadata>
  </description>
  <manifestation>
    <identifier>
      <catalog>manifestation-cmr-id</catalog>
      <entry>105548</entry>
    </identifier>
    <name>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.manifestationNameValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>experience</value>
    </name>
    <item>
      <location>
        <uri>http://www.oercommons.org/courses/a-more-perfect-union-japanese-americans-and-the-u-s-constitution</uri>
      </location>
    </item>
  </manifestation>
</expression>
